key_responsibilities: driving the Member to and from events
ensuring the member’s schedule is executed
handling tour and flag requests
helping manage the internship program
managing incoming calls and voicemails
coordinating member correspondence
assisting with legislative work
staffing and managing the front office
answering the phone
greeting visitors
providing additional office support
staffing hearings and markups
conducting oversight
drafting legislation
advising staff and members on legislative and non-legislative matters
requirements: minimum of 4 years of experience in the U.S. House of Representatives
knowledgeable of current legislative and non-legislative issues
thorough understanding of the legislative process and the organization and procedures of the House of Representatives
strong writing, analytical, and legislative skills
willingness to work long hours and weekends
experience working with relevant public interest groups, agencies, Congress, and industry stakeholders

key_responsibilities: constituent casework
community outreach
meeting with local stakeholders
representing the Congresswoman at community and government events
special projects
general project and event work
assisting constituents resolve problems with federal agencies
finding appropriate state or local contact for non-federal issues
maintaining, strengthening, and establishing new relationships with local community stakeholders
managing projects and large-scale public events
requirements: understanding or experience with government agencies
strong written, communication, analytical, and organizational skills
ability to relate well with individuals of diverse backgrounds
skilled in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Publisher and Power Point
ability to work efficiently and effectively as a member of a team
ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously
enjoy working with the public and constituents
flexibility to work weekends, some holidays, and after-hours
salary: will depend on the experience of the applicant

key_responsibilities: processing all Washington scheduling requests
coordinating Member and staff travel to and from the district
working with the Chief of Staff and Member to make sure the daily schedule is both efficient and effective
requirements: ability to work in a fast-paced environment
ability to adapt to changing circumstances and working environment
strong oral and written communication skills
ability to exercise discretion and maintain confidentiality
Hill or other executive scheduling experience
mastery of Microsoft Outlook and Teams

key_responsibilities: assisting the legislative, constituent services and administrative functions of the office
monitoring and processing constituent mail and other communications
managing constituent tours
coordinating DC and district office issues
legislative correspondent and casework assistance
requirements: ability to work independently and effectively under pressure
ability to make decisions and solve problems
excellent verbal communication and writing skills

office: House Committee on Oversight and Reform Majority Staff
key_responsibilities: managing the website
crafting content for social media channels
developing graphics and videos
covering hearings and press events
working with our press team to identify new ways to engage our followers
requirements: 1 to 2 years of communications and digital experience
enjoy working in a fast-paced, rapid response environment

office: House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
key_responsibilities: leading data and research collection and analysis
leading the development of the required diversity report
maintaining key metrics and key performance indicators
serving as a resource for external and internal diversity best practices
serving as the project manager for any consultants and/or contractors
assisting in the translation of research findings into materials
providing research support on diversity and inclusion studies
researching and studying best practices for retention and growth in House employing offices
leading data tracking and reporting with a focus on performance and results
preparing regular updates and briefing documents on research
assisting with the development and delivery of training sessions
conducting presentations at professional conferences and meetings
requirements: Master’s degree in social or behavioral sciences or related field
knowledge and experience in diversity, equity, and inclusion research efforts
current working knowledge of coalition functioning, evaluation and research
quantitative and qualitative evaluation and research skills
ability to work harmoniously with a diverse team
ability to work under deadline pressure and extra hours
